metadata.title: CVE-2024-38560 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:scsi: bfa: Ensure the copied buf is NUL terminatedCurrently, we allocate a nbytes-sized kernel buffer and copy nbytes fromuserspace to that buffer. Later, we use sscanf on this buffer but we don'tensure that the string is terminated inside the buffer, this can lead toOOB read when using sscanf. Fix this issue by using memdup_user_nul insteadof memdup_user.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
